bill_title: to define the purpose of the Sioux Falls Center for Public Higher Education.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to define the purpose of the Sioux Falls Center for Public Higher Education. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-54 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The purpose of the Sioux Falls Center for Public Higher Education is to provide educational opportunities, including graduate and undergraduate programs, with emphasis on the needs of the adult population desiring career advancement and personal enrichment in response to economic and employment needs. The individual institutions controlled by the Board of Regents may offer programs, courses, and services consistent with their respective missions through the center as authorized and directed by the board. The board may enter into cooperative, academic programming agreements with other accredited academic institutions as may be permitted under South Dakota law. In structuring the programs and policies for the center, the board shall foster a seamless education system designed to maximize opportunities, to promote a better quality of life for all persons, and to sustain economic vitality in the state's communities by providing ease of mobility within an integrated, efficient, quality education system.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
